cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 135 mi (215 km) SE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then northeast, tracking slowly toward the north-central Gulf Coast (MS/AL shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi-Alabama border (around Biloxi-Gulfport)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning from Morgan City, LA to Navarre, FL; Tropical-Storm Watch/Warning east of Navarre to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to Navarre, FL; Tropical-Storm Warning east of Navarre to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (<5% probability).
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1â€“3 inches of rain to the Florida peninsula, including Miami.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the Atlantic beaches of South Florida.
